trans-unit.source: Provides multi-targeting for Windows Workflow Designer hosts.

*Multi-targeting* is the ability to find the right version of the loaded assembly that corresponds to the target [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] version of the current workflow project in [!INCLUDE[vs2010](~/includes/vs2010-md.md)].
trans-unit.target: *Funzionalità di multitargeting* è la possibilità di trovare la versione corretta dell'assembly caricato che corrisponde alla destinazione [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] versione del progetto flusso di lavoro corrente in [!INCLUDE[vs2010](~/includes/vs2010-md.md)].

trans-unit.source: This interface is implemented and used internally by [!INCLUDE[wf1](~/includes/wf1-md.md)] designer components to resolve [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] assemblies in a multi-targeting aware fashion within the [!INCLUDE[vs2010](~/includes/vs2010-md.md)] hosting application.
trans-unit.target: Questa interfaccia viene implementata e utilizzata internamente dai componenti della finestra di progettazione di [!INCLUDE[wf1](~/includes/wf1-md.md)] per risolvere gli assembly [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] con una procedura compatibile con il multitargeting nell'applicazione host [!INCLUDE[vs2010](~/includes/vs2010-md.md)].

trans-unit.source: The [!INCLUDE[wf1](~/includes/wf1-md.md)] designer components use the implementation of this interface only when additional assemblies need to be loaded dynamically into the editing `AppDomain`.
trans-unit.target: Il [!INCLUDE[wf1](~/includes/wf1-md.md)] componenti della finestra di progettazione usano l'implementazione di questa interfaccia solo quando necessario assembly aggiuntivi da caricare in modo dinamico la modifica `AppDomain`.

trans-unit.source: Returns the currently loaded assembly given the assembly name.
The currently loaded assembly given the assembly name.
The type to get the runtime type of.
Gets the runtime type that corresponds to the specified type.
The runtime type that corresponds to the specified type.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified type is supported.
<see langword="true" /> if the specified type is supported; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
